issue.title: Implemented new ascanrule TestUserAgent
issue.body: Check for differences in content based on User Agent. Different content could be returned if there is a mobile site. Some websites provides different content if a search engine Crawler access the site.

body: Do you have any examples where this happens?

The messages with empty responses are the "temporary" messages created for the Sites tree. An example that would lead to FP is the scanner TestUserAgent since it was comparing the responses using the base message, although there are other scanners [1](?) [2] that are sending the original request to obtain the response (which shouldn't as that might modify the original request).
The passive scanner ignores the temporary messages, maybe it should happen the same with active scanner? The user would have to explicitly access those pages to have them scanned though.

[1] https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/tree/1aea8538f7fb207d62015faef731cfdac1de21cd/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/ascanrulesAlpha/SlackerCookieDetector.java#L46-L51
[2] https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/tree/1aea8538f7fb207d62015faef731cfdac1de21cd/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/ascanrulesAlpha/SourceCodeDisclosureFileInclusion.java#L213-L214

OK, that explains it.
So we've never had responses to these requests.
Some options:
- Automatically request such pages when adding them to the tree (which I really dont like;)
- Automatically request such pages prior to active scanning (much more acceptable)
- Not active scanning these pages
- Adding an option to not scan these pages (not keen on that either)
- Ensuring all rules can cope with null responses (which is kind of what we should be doing now)
  Any preferences, or alternative suggestions?

issue.title: Charset Mismatch must not showing on alerts

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
We just scan out application and this allert shows up saying 

There was a charset mismatch between the HTTP Header and the HTML encoding declaration: [null] and [ISO-8859-1] do not match.

Response header:
`Content-Type: text/html;charset=ISO-8859-1`

Response Body:
`<meta charset="ISO-8859-1" content="text/html" http-equiv="content-type">`

Notice that the charset is both set to ISO-8859-1.

Rootcause: OWASP ZAP is unable to get the charset value of either the header or in the response.

We just analyze the problem. Please confirm if this is a bug. 

Thanks!
-Ronelle

body: I'd opt for "Not active scanning these pages".

What would the impact of this be?
The only thing I can think of offhand is if someone scanned a 'temporary' page and chose not to recurse. Right now all of the AbstractHostPlugins and AbstractAppPlugins run. With this change I think nothing would happen - is that right? That might be confusing for some people, especially if they wanted to check things like a site certificate.
Agreed, lets try to obtain the response prior the actual scan.

issue.title: Ensure messages to be scanned have a response

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change HostProcess to send the message if it doesn't have a response,
prior being scanned.

Fix #1964 - ZAP should ensure response in base message before passing
them to scanners

issue.title: ascanrulesBeta: remove unnecessary check
issue.body:
Remove check no longer needed in BackupFileDisclosure, which compared
to a 0 status code (i.e. an empty response, which no longer happens).

Related to zaproxy/zaproxy#1964 - ZAP should ensure response in base
message before passing them to scanners

issue.title: ascanrulesAlpha: do not resend "base" message
issue.body:
Change SlackerCookieDetector and TestUserAgent to not resend the "base"
message (for the latter scanner it was a new message), it should not be
modified and it's no longer needed (the base message is now guaranteed
to have response).
Update changes in ZapAddOn.xml file.

Related to zaproxy/zaproxy#1964 - ZAP should ensure response in base
message before passing them to scanners

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
